item.title: Balatro Hits Big Sales Milestone After Being Showered With Awards
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/balatro-hits-big-sales-milestone-after-being-showered-with-awards/1100-6528912/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Developer Localthunk has revealed that Balatro has recently passed the 5 million sales milestone across all platforms.

"The last few weeks have been pretty wild. To everyone who picked up Balatro after seeing it at The Game Awards, we hope you're having an amazing time with it," the developer said on Twitter. "If this is your first time picking up an indie title, try to make it a habit!"

According to Balatro's publisher, Playstack, the 5 million mark doesn't include downloads from Apple Arcade. Additionally, the game was sitting at 3.5 million copies sold at the first week of December, indicating that it received a boost in exposure after being nominated as a Game of the Year candidate at The Game Awards 2024.

Balatro has also been nominated at other awards shows, including the New York Game Awards 2025, the Steam Awards 2024, and the 28th Annual Dice Awards. Balatro is also one of GameSpot's 10 best games of 2024.

In GameSpot's Balatro review, we said, "Balatro's ingenious combination of poker and roguelite gameplay creates an intoxicating combination that's hard to pull away from."

item.title: Former Dragon Age Director's Eternal Strands Gets PC Demo, Full Specs Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/former-dragon-age-directors-eternal-strands-gets-pc-demo-full-specs-revealed/1100-6528911/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A PC demo for the action-adventure game Eternal Strands is now available for a limited time. The demo covers the game's "Part 1" and should take between 1-4 hours to complete. Any progress made in it will also carry over to the full game.

In the demo, players will be able to explore two areas of The Envclave and fight up to three types of Epics. Additionally, players have access to the crafting system, three weapon types, and a limited set of magic spells. The three base weapon types are sword & shield, bow & arrow, and two-hander.

While the demo and game aren't yet Steam Deck verified, developer Yellow Brick Games said that they can be played on the handheld and it's still working on getting the verification status. The demo will be removed at a later date, but more details will come in the next few days regarding exactly when.

The demo is only available on PC for Steam and Epic Games Store players, but the game will also be launching for PlayStation and Xbox on January 28 at $40. It'll also be available on Xbox Game Pass at launch.

Yellow Brick Games was founded in 2020 by former BioWare veteran Mike Laidlaw, who is now the creative director of Eternal Strands. He worked on the Dragon Age series before leaving BioWare in 2017.

Eternal Strands PC specs:

Minimum requirements

  • CPU: Intel Core i5-9400 / AMD Ryzen 5 3350G
  • RAM: 8 GB RAM
  • GPU: Nvidia GeForce GTX 1660 Super 6GB / AMD Radeon RX 5600 XT 6GB / Intel Arc A580
  • DX: Version 12
  • OS: Windows 10 / Windows 11 (64-bit)
  • Storage: 24 GB
  • Additional notes: The hardware above reflects game performance at 60fps at the lowest graphics setting upscaled from 50% of 1080p resolution (without frame generation)

Recommended requirements:

  • CPU: Intel Core i5-11600 / AMD Ryzen 5 5600X
  • RAM: 16 GB RAM
  • GPU: Nvidia GeForce RTX 3070 8GB / AMD Radeon RX 6800 16GB / Intel Arc A770
  • DX: Version 12
  • OS: Windows 10 / Windows 11 (64-bit)
  • Storage: 24 GB
  • Additional notes: The hardware above reflects game performance at 60fps at epic graphics setting upscaled from 50% of 1440p resolution (without frame generation)
